JUDGES: André Potocki;Angelika Nußberger;Carlo Ranzoni;Erik Møse;Ganna Yudkivska;Síofra O’Leary
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP and NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . He was represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
CARDINAL . The Government of GPE ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent at the time , ORG .

CARDINAL . ORG , having been informed of their right to intervene in the proceedings ( Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW CARDINAL of the Rules of Court ) , indicated that they did not wish to exercise that right .
CARDINAL . The applicant was an officer of the JNA , the armed forces of the former ORG . The present case concerns his attempt to regain possession of his pre - war flat in GPE .

CARDINAL . The detailed background concerning socially owned flats , military flats and the involvement of foreign armed forces in the DATE - CARDINAL war in GPE is provided in GPE v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , CARDINAL DATE and PERSON and Others v. GPE , nos . CARDINAL et al . , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant was allocated an occupancy right to a military flat in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE he bought that flat under the terms of the Military Flats Act DATE and paid the full purchase price in the amount of MONEY ( MONEY ( ORG ) at the time ) .
CARDINAL . When the PERSON formally withdrew from GPE on DATE , the applicant continued his military career in the FAC forces and left GPE . His military service was terminated in DATE .

CARDINAL . During the DATE - CARDINAL war in GPE the flats of those who had fled were declared “ abandoned ” and allocated to new occupants ( see PERSON and Others , cited above , § DATE ) . On DATE the applicant applied for the restitution of his flat to the competent administrative authority in the GPE Canton .
CARDINAL . Following CARDINAL remittal on procedural grounds , on DATE his application was rejected pursuant to section CARDINAL of ORG . On DATE the competent ORG upheld that decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ the Cantonal Court ” ) , following an application for judicial review , upheld the second - instance decision of CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Constitutional Court of Bosnia and GPE ( “ the Constitutional Court ” ) rejected the applicant ’s constitutional appeal and upheld the impugned decisions .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained to ORG ( a domestic human - rights body set up under Annex CARDINAL to ORG ) about his inability to repossess his pre - war flat . He relied on LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( the legal successor of ORG ) found a violation of LAW on account of the length of the restitution proceedings and awarded the applicant MONEY ( BAM ; MONEY ( ORG ) ) for non - pecuniary damage in this connection . As regards the complaint under LAW No . CARDINAL , the Commission concluded that the interference with the applicant ’s right to the peaceful enjoyment of his possessions had been justified . However , it ordered ORG to secure the applicant ’s right to compensation for his pre - war flat envisaged under section ORG , without further delay and at the latest within DATE from the delivery of that decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE the government of ORG requested the applicant to provide his contact and bank account details in order to pay the awarded compensation . The applicant provided those details .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed to ORG against the decision of ORG of DATE . On DATE ORG declared that it lacked jurisdiction to examine the case .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant initiated proceedings before ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) seeking to establish the validity of the purchase contract of CARDINAL DATE ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) and to register his title to the flat in the land register .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG declared the purchase contract legally valid . However , it rejected the applicant ’s claim to have his title registered . Under LAW DATE those who served in foreign armed forces after the DATE - CARDINAL war , like the applicant , were not entitled to repossess their pre - war military flats and to register their title , but were entitled to compensation . On DATE ORG upheld that judgment .
CARDINAL . The Government did not dispute the facts submitted by the applicant . However , they provided additional information as follows .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant received BAM CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL ( approximately EUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL.CARDINAL ) in compensation for his pre - war flat in accordance with section LANGUAGE of ORG as ordered by ORG ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) . The amount was transferred to his bank account in GPE .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice were outlined in PERSON v. GPE ( no . GPE , § § DATE , DATE ) .
